foragingBee
Class AbstractMovingAgent

java.lang.Object
  sim.portrayal.SimplePortrayal2D
      foragingBee.AbstractMovingAgent
All Implemented Interfaces:
IMovingAgent, java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable, sim.portrayal.Portrayal, sim.portrayal.Portrayal2D
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractSphericAgent, Bee
public abstract class AbstractMovingAgent
extends sim.portrayal.SimplePortrayal2D
implements sim.engine.Steppable, IMovingAgent

An abstract class for a moving object. Used by several subclasses that are locating and moving objects in space. Every agent has an orientation (given in degrees) and a velocity (given as a vector but heading in the same direction as the orientation).

Copyright 2009 Joerg Hoehne

Author:
hoehne (Jörg Höhne)
See Also:

getObjectsWithinMyDistance

public IMovingAgent[] getObjectsWithinMyDistance(double radius,
                                                 boolean useMySphere,
                                                 boolean useTheirSpheres,
                                                 boolean includeMySelf)
Return the objects within the distance of this object. Due to the dimension of an object the sphere of both objects might be included in the computation.

Parameters:
radius - The distance we are looking for.
useMySphere - Use this agents sphere for reducing the distance between this agent and others
useTheirSpheres - Use the others agents spheres to reduce the distance
includeMySelf - Shall the agent itself be included in the results?
Returns:
The objects meeting the criteria.

getObjectsWithinMyDistance

public IMovingAgent[] getObjectsWithinMyDistance(double radius,
                                                 boolean useMySphere,
                                                 boolean useTheirSpheres,
                                                 double maxSphere,
                                                 boolean includeMySelf,
                                                 java.lang.Class<?> type)
This method returns all objects that are within a radius of the this object. The computation is done in several stages and configurations. First the distance between objects (agents) is measured from center to center. The center is a point so it has no dimension.
The parameter radius controls the radius from the center of the current object (agent) where the center of the other objects (agents) have to lie within to be returned.
Every agent in the simulation has a sphere given by a radius. This radius can be used to compute if a center of an other objects lies inside the sphere. This behaviour is configured by the parameter useMySphere. The usage of the sphere of the other object (agent) instead of its center is controlled by useTheirSpheres.
The parameter maxSphere defines the maximum radius of all other agents used for computing the distance in which one object (agent) have to be in maximum to be returned.

Parameters:
radius - The radius where to look for other objects (agents).
useMySphere - Is the center or sphere of an other object inside by sphere.
useTheirSpheres - Use the sphere of the other object instead of the center point.
maxSphere - The maximum sphere of all other objects (agents).
includeMySelf - If the returned objects shall include this object (agent).
type - If this type is not null only objects (agents) of the defined type (or subclass) are returned.
Returns:
The objects meeting the criteria.

angle

public double angle(IMovingAgent agent)
Return the angle between this agent and the given one. This is the absolute angle between both points represented by the agents. No orientation is attended.

isInSphere

public final boolean isInSphere(IMovingAgent agent)
Compute if the location of an agent is inside the sphere of this agent. The outer sphere of the agent is not considered, only the center of the agent.

Parameters:
agent - The agent whose sphere will be tested.
Returns:
True, if this agent is inside the other agent's sphere.

isInSphere

public final boolean isInSphere(IMovingAgent agent,
                                boolean useSphere)
Compute if the location of an agent if it is inside the sphere of this agent. The consideration of the other agents sphere is optional. If the sphere is used for computation false is returned if the sphere of the agent is (partially) out of this sphere.

Parameters:
agent - The agent whose sphere will be tested.
useSphere - If true the sphere of this agent will also used to decide if this agent's sphere intersects with the other agent's sphere.
Returns:
True, if this agent is inside the other agent's sphere.

distanceToSphere

public final double distanceToSphere(IMovingAgent agent,
                                     boolean useSphere)
Compute the distance of the given agent to the outer sphere perimeter of this agent. The sphere perimeter of the agent also can be used otherwise the center.

Parameters:
agent - The other agent.
useSphere - If true use the outer perimeter of the other agent.
Returns:
The distance to the other agent's sphere.
